Name: ABC Names
Description: The nemes given to each english letter

Name: CVC Blending
Description: The blending of Consonant -> Vowel -> Consonant Word (ex: mom, cat, dad)

Name: Sight Words
Description: Words that Comprise the majority of Frys' words

Name: Short Vowel Word Families
Description: Words that have a common short vowel sound. Words like this create a family

Name: Long Vowels
Description: Words that have a common long vowel sound. Words like this create a family

Name: Magic E
Description: The magic E rule states when the letter "e" sits at the end of the word, it is usually silent and the "magical" E tells the first vowel or the preceding vowel to say its name or long sound.

Name: Consonant Digraphs
Description: Consonant digraphs are two (or three) letters that come together to make one sound.

Name: Final Blends
Description: Attending to final blends helps students decode words that end with sk, sp, st, mp, nd, nk, nt, ld, lf, lk, lp, lt, ct, ft, or pt.

Name: Soft Letters
Description: A letter can have multiple sounds depending on the word; cap/cell, Usually a consonant that follow a vowel: Consider the following: When a G meets an a,o,u, it's sound it hard. When a G meats an a, o, or, u, then it sounds hard.

Name: Silent Letters
Description: Silet letters can often appear at the beginning or end of a word; (Know, Knack, Knuckle - The K is silenct) (Muscle, Scene - the E is silent)

Name: Diphthongs
Description: diphthong is a vowel in which there is a noticeable sound change within the same syllable

Name: Vowel Diagraphs
Description: Vowel digraphs are combination of vowels that combine to make a single vowel sound like the OA in boat, the AI in rain, the EE in feet, the EA in sea, and the OO in moon.

Name: Short Vowels
Description: Short vowels are vowel sounds that are pronounced in a short form. In English the short vowel sounds are those in 'pet', 'pot', 'put', 'putt', 'pat' and 'pit'

Name: Long Vowels
Description: A long vowel is a vowel sound that is pronounced the same way as the name of the letter itself. For example, the long U sound is pronounced like "yoo," as would be the case in words like "lure" and "tube.

Name: R Control
Description: Controlled R words are exactly that, words that are controlled by the letter R. Controlled R words are words like: “Bar, Car, Far, Hard, Lard, Tar, and Star.” In these words the “Ar” produces the sound of the Letter Named "R."
